subject: Web3
title: Wash Trading in NFTs
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Wash Trading in NFTs.

hook.text: Some NFT sellers bought their own pieces to fake demand. It's called wash trading, and it was rampant.

buildup.text: A seller creates two wallets, lists an NFT, and buys it from themselves at an inflated price.

discovery.text: Blockchain analysts estimated that up to 80% of trading volume on some platforms was wash trading.

twist.text: Platforms that offered token rewards for trading made it worse. Users traded with themselves to farm rewards.

climax.text: Wash trading inflated the market's apparent size. Real demand was a fraction of what headlines reported.

punchline.text: Much of the NFT market was people selling to themselves.

quiz.question: What is wash trading in NFTs?
options: Buying your own NFTs to fake demand and inflate prices
